title: Eli Ankou
text:
Eli Ankou (born June 8, 1994) is a Canadian professional <a href="American%20football">football</a> <a href="nose%20tackle">nose tackle</a> who is a free agent. He played <a href="college%20football">college football</a> at <a href="UCLA%20Bruins%20football">UCLA</a>. Ankou grew up in Canada and played high school football for the <a href="St.%20Peter%20Catholic%20High%20School">St. Peter Catholic High School</a> Knights in Orleans, Ontario, but played his senior season at Red Lion Christian Academy in <a href="Bear%2C%20Delaware">Bear, Delaware</a>.
Early years.
Ankou attended <a href="St.%20Peter%20Catholic%20High%20School">St. Peter Catholic High School</a> and Red Lion Christian Academy, where he played as a strong side <a href="defensive%20end">defensive end</a>. He accepted a football scholarship from <a href="UCLA">UCLA</a>.
As a true freshman, he didn't appear in any games. As a sophomore, he missed most of the season with an injury. He appeared in 3 games as a backup, making one tackle.
As a junior, he appeared in all 13 games as backup, posting 5 tackles (1 for loss).
As a senior, he became a starter after <a href="Eddie%20Vanderdoes">Eddie Vanderdoes</a> was lost for the season with a right knee injury. He appeared in 13 games with 11 starts, registering 47 tackles (ninth on the team), 5 tackles for loss (tied for fourth on the team). He had 7 tackles against the <a href="University%20of%20Colorado%20Boulder">University of Colorado</a>. He made 6 tackles against <a href="Stanford%20University">Stanford University</a>. He finished his career with 38 games (19 starts), 91 tackles (8 for loss), 1.5 sacks, three passes defensed and one fumble recovery.
Professional career.
Houston Texans.
Ankou was signed as an <a href="undrafted%20free%20agent">undrafted free agent</a> by the <a href="Houston%20Texans">Houston Texans</a> after the <a href="2017%20NFL%20Draft">2017 NFL Draft</a> on May 12. He was waived by the Texans on September 2, 2017.
Jacksonville Jaguars.
On September 3, 2017, Ankou was claimed off waivers by the <a href="Jacksonville%20Jaguars">Jacksonville Jaguars</a>. 
In 2017, he appeared in nine games as a backup, posting 15 tackles (one for loss), 1.5 sacks and two quarterback pressures. In 2018, he appeared in two games as a backup and had four tackles. On September 1, 2019, Ankou was waived by the Jaguars and re-signed to the practice squad on September 3.
Cleveland Browns.
Ankou was signed by the <a href="Cleveland%20Browns">Cleveland Browns</a> off the Jaguars' practice squad on October 22, 2019. Ankou appeared in 9 games with 2 starts, tallying 7 tackles (one for loss). He was waived by the Browns on September 6, 2020.
Indianapolis Colts.
On September 7, 2020, Ankou was claimed off waivers by the <a href="Indianapolis%20Colts">Indianapolis Colts</a>. He was declared inactive during the first 5 weeks of the season. He was waived on October 17.
Houston Texans (second stint).
On October 19, 2020, Ankou was claimed off waivers by the Houston Texans and placed on the exempt/commissioner permission list. On October 26, he was activated from the exempt/commissioner permission list.
Dallas Cowboys.
On November 2, 2020, Ankou was traded to the <a href="Dallas%20Cowboys">Dallas Cowboys</a> in exchange for a 7th round draft pick in the <a href="2022%20NFL%20Draft">2022 NFL Draft</a>. He was acquired to provide depth after the release of <a href="defensive%20tackle">defensive tackle</a> <a href="Dontari%20Poe">Dontari Poe</a> and to help improve a <a href="defensive%20line">defensive line</a> that was struggling to stop the run. He appeared in 7 games as a backup, tallying 5 tackles and one quarterback pressure. He wasn't re-signed after the season.
Atlanta Falcons.
On May 17, 2021, Ankou signed with the <a href="Atlanta%20Falcons">Atlanta Falcons</a>. He was waived on June 17, 2021.
Buffalo Bills.
On June 22, 2021, Ankou signed with the <a href="Buffalo%20Bills">Buffalo Bills</a>. He was waived on August 15.
Atlanta Falcons (second stint).
On August 18, 2021, Ankou signed with the Atlanta Falcons. He was waived on August 31, 2021.
Pittsburgh Steelers.
On October 5, 2021, Ankou was signed to the <a href="Pittsburgh%20Steelers">Pittsburgh Steelers</a> practice squad. He was released on October 12.
Tennessee Titans.
On October 26, 2021, Ankou was signed to the <a href="Tennessee%20Titans">Tennessee Titans</a> practice squad. On November 1, 2021, Ankou as released from the practice squad.
Buffalo Bills (second stint).
On November 16, 2021, Ankou was signed to the Buffalo Bills practice squad.
Personal life.
Ankou is an <a href="Ojibwe">Ojibwe</a> of the <a href="Dokis%20First%20Nation">Dokis First Nation</a> through his mother Violet Bellefeuille, while his father Adolphe is originally from the <a href="West%20Africa">West African</a> nation of <a href="Togo">Togo</a>. He has been in a relationship with American racing cyclist <a href="Shayna%20Powless">Shayna Powless</a> since 2013, after the couple met at UCLA: as of 2021 the couple were engaged.
